Articles.Content:
Description:

A challenge to see who has the best Mun Base. Will be ranked on 5 categories: Complexity/simpleness, special awards accomplished, principle behind idea, uniqueness, and finally EPICNESS. I hope many will try, and lastly Good Luck.

Rules:

1.May not use mods in final design. Exceptions are Kethane and that you may use them to get into the Mun's orbit such as Hyper Edit, Mech Jeb, etc (may not use mods to land) Secondly you may use them to help dock KAS etc.

2.Must be your design no using .crafts from other people.

3.Must have at least 3 crew quarters hitchhikers count.

4. 4th and finale must follow category, Mining, outpost, settlement, or your own idea (please include what category it follows.)

Special Awards:

Neil Kerbstrong: First to enter.

Kerbilia Earhart: Base has designated runway and at least 1 vtol and 2 space planes.

Model K: Base has fully stocked garage (3 or more rovers and 1 motor cycle)

Munopia: Has 10 or more modules.

Hal9000: Base fully complete no mods or anything and done using your brain the first portable computer.

Aerea 51: Base is connected in circular fashion.

Kethane Kebals: Fully stock Kethane base.

Good luck

Leader Boards:

1.Highlad---Neil Kerbstrong, Hal9000, and Munopia

2.Captain Sierra---None

3.______________________

4.______________________

5.______________________

Edited February 15, 2014 by Blakester
Sounds cool might try it tomorrow once you choose the top few entries you should start a poll to determine the winner (and yes uniqueness is a word)
Ok i might look into that and thanks for the grammar help

Runway? Mun? It has atmosphere????

No but it is still possible to land planes with liquid fuel engines.
Is there a time limit? I'll be trying this soon
Seems silly to forbid mods when they're one of the only ways to make a base worth bothering with. Particularly since one of your categories is a mining base, something that stock can't even support.

Well, I cant say I made this for this challenge, but i will certainly submit it

I would call this a settlement at the moment, but I plan to expand it into a mining and science facility.

Neil Kerbstrong: First to enter.

Munopia: Has 10 or more modules.

Hal9000: Base fully complete no mods or anything and done using your brain the first portable computer.

An old one of mine using Temstar's pack:

I lost this to a version rollover. I've since redesigned Temstar's stuff to better fit my art style while also being atmospheric landable. I am currently in the process of a major Duna base, so I'll enter than instead if you don't mind (or I can do my Ike base that will come later, but you'll be waiting).

Well, I cant say I made this for this challenge, but i will certainly submit it

I would call this a settlement at the moment, but I plan to expand it into a mining and science facility.

Neil Kerbstrong: First to enter.

Munopia: Has 10 or more modules.

Hal9000: Base fully complete no mods or anything and done using your brain the first portable computer.

Sorry I haven't bean on for a while but Highlad Since first to enter gets first place. And Captain Sierra I will put you in sec on with no special challenges since i don't see any from your photo. I will also if you want update the board for your Duna base.

Edited February 15, 2014 by Blakester

Seems silly to forbid mods when they're one of the only ways to make a base worth bothering with. Particularly since one of your categories is a mining base, something that stock can't even support.

Yes thank you for reminding me i meant to have it no obscure mods i will correct it to allow Kethane.
there are definately some more mods you should allow - I don't really make bases without EP launchpads and Bobcat HOME.

Don't know if i qualify since i used the FASA mod, but here it is, I uploaded it to youtube and was just starting out when i found this on the forum. If it doesn't count, then just disregard this.

Mun Base video:

Yeah, I think the forbidding of most mods oughta be tossed. That aside, My duna base is coming along . . . slowly. I may decide to do things legit once and then take the tedium out of it with HyperEdit.
